sentence.Network_en: Poor Dr Pegler got terribly behindhand with his appointments.
sentence.Network_cn: 可怜的佩格勒博士大大落后于当初的约定。

sentence.Network_en: I think he misses her terribly. You might cheer him up.
sentence.Network_cn: 我估计他是太想念她了。也许你可以让他打起点儿精神来。

sentence.Network_en: Even clever people are not terribly clever when put on the spot.
sentence.Network_cn: 即便是聪明人在面对难题时也未必就能表现得特别聪明。

...land Rape) 的系列设计，他因此又被称做“可怕顽童”(enfant terrible) 和“英国时尚界流氓”(the hooligan of English fashion) 。

1000实用英语口语短句循环朗读速记 - 豆丁网 ... That' s life. 这就是生活。 That' s terrible. 真糟糕！ The deuce. 糟糕。.
惊吓英语句子 ... That's spooky! 阴森森的！ That's terrible! 好恐怖！ How awful! 可怕噢！.
许多人谈到「可怕的两岁」（terrible two），都以为孩子过了两岁生日才开始。事实上，可怕的两岁，指的是孩子十八个月到三岁左右。

entry.tran: 非常严重的;骇人的;糟糕的
entry.def: A terrible experience or situation is very serious or very unpleasant.

example.ex: Tens of thousands more suffered terrible injuries in the world's worst industrial disaster...
example.tran: 还有成千上万的人在那场全世界最严重的工业灾难中受了重伤。

example.ex: I often have the most terrible nightmares...

entry.tran: (感觉或看起来)病得很重的，心情很糟的
entry.def: If you feel terrible, you feel extremely ill or unhappy. If you tell someone that they look terrible, you mean that they look as if they are extremely ill or unhappy.

example.ex: He did feel terrible at the time but seems to be fine now...
example.tran: 他当时确实很难受，但现在似乎好了。

example.ex: Are you all right? You look terrible. Are you sick?
example.tran: 你没事儿吧？你的脸色很难看，生病了吗？

entry.def: If something is terrible, it is very bad or of very poor quality.

example.ex: She admits her French is terrible.
example.tran: 她承认自己的法语很蹩脚。

entry.tran: (用来加强语气)十足的，极度的，不折不扣的
entry.def: You use terrible to emphasize the great extent or degree of something.

example.ex: I was a terrible fool, you know. I remember that now...
example.tran: 你知道，我那时愚蠢至极。我至今还记得。

example.ex: Her death is a terrible waste.

auth_sentence.content: Both are terribly delicate, but equally mightily talented.
auth_sentence.res_content: Both are terribly delicate, but equally mightily talented.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Both are terribly delicate, but equally mightily talented.

auth_sentence.content: The story so far does not look terribly good.
auth_sentence.res_content: The story so far does not look terribly good.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The story so far does not look terribly good.

auth_sentence.content: Maybe, although I don't feel terribly afraid.
auth_sentence.res_content: Maybe, although I don't feel terribly afraid.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Maybe, although I don't feel terribly afraid.

sentences.en: After her husband’s death she felt terribly alone.
sentences.cn: 丈夫死后,她感到非常地孤独。

sentences.en: He is terribly ashamed of what he did.
sentences.cn: 他为自己所干的事愧疚不堪。

sentences.en: He suffered terribly when his mother died.
sentences.cn: 他母亲去世时,他非常痛苦。

sentences.en: It all sounds terribly involved and complicated.
sentences.cn: 这事听起来非常错综复杂。

means.word_mean: 极度地;严重地;很厉害地

sentences.en: He got terribly drunk and was throwing up for most of the night.
sentences.cn: 他喝得烂醉,呕吐了大半夜。

sentences.en: It was terribly hot and I started to feel strange.
sentences.cn: 天气热得要命,我开始觉得难受起来。
